00054 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00055 
00056     /* Kernel mode side */
00057 
00058     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or
00059                                    &user->thread.esp).
00060                                    DONT MOVE THIS MEMBER,
00061                                    switch_to depends on it. */
00062 
00063     struct ia64_fpreg fpuenv[96]; /* FIXME FPU: check if alignment constraints
00064                                      are needed. */
00065     
00066     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00067     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00068     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00069 
00070     /* User mode side */
00071 
00072     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00073     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00074 
00075     struct ia64_fpreg *fpup;
00076 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00077 
00078 } xnarchtcb_t;
00079

00087 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->trap)
00088 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->ia64.isr)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->ia64.regs->cr_iip)
00090 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00091    Linux stack context. */
00092 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00093                                  (fi)->trap != ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP)

00098 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00099 
00100 {
00101     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00102         return vmalloc(bytes);
00103 
00104     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00105 }
00106 
00107 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00108 
00109 {
00110     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00111         vfree(chunk);
00112     else
00113         kfree(chunk);
00114 }

00116 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00117 
00118 {
00119 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00120     adeos_send_ipi(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ, cpu_online_map);
00121 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00122     adeos_trigger_irq(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ);
00123 #endif
00124 }

00132 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00133                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00134 {
00135     int err = rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);
00136     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00137     long long delta;
00138 
00139     if (err)
00140         return err;
00141 
00142     adeos_load_cpuid();
00143     delta = __adeos_itm_next[cpuid] - ia64_get_itc();
00144     
00145     return delta < 0LL ? 0LL : xnarch_tsc_to_ns(delta);
00146 }
00147 
00148 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00149 
00150 {
00151     struct task_struct *fpu_owner
00152         = (struct task_struct *)ia64_get_kr(IA64_KR_FPU_OWNER);
00153     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00154 
00155     adeos_load_cpuid();
00156 
00157     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00158     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00159     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00160     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00161     rootcb->fpup = fpu_owner ? fpu_owner->thread.fph : NULL;
00162 }
00163 
00164 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00165 {
00166     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00167 }
00168 
00169 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00170                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00171 {
00172     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00173     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00174 
00175     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00176 
00177     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00178         {
00179         /* We are switching to a user task different from the last
00180            preempted or running user task, so that we can use the
00181            Linux context switch routine. */
00182         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00183         struct task_struct *last;
00184 
00185         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00186 
00187         if (!inproc->mm)
00188             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00189 
00190         __switch_to(outproc, inproc, last);
00191         }
00192     else
00193         {
00194         /* Use our own light switch routine. */
00195         unsigned long gp;
00196 
00197         ia64_stop();
00198         gp = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_GP);
00199         ia64_stop();
00200         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb,in_tcb);
00201         ia64_stop();
00202         ia64_setreg(_IA64_REG_GP, gp);
00203         ia64_stop();
00204 
00205         /* fph will be enabled by xnarch_restore_fpu if needed, and
00206            returns the root thread in its usual mode. */
00207         ia64_fph_disable();
00208         }
00209 }
00210 
00211 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00212                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00213 {
00214     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00215 }
00216 
00217 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00218 
00219 {
00220     /* Empty */
00221 }
00222 
00223 #define fph2task(faddr)                                 \
00224     ((struct task_struct *)((char *) (faddr) -          \
00225                             (size_t) &((struct task_struct *) 0)->thread.fph[0]))
00226 
00227 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00228 
00229 {
00230     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00231        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00232     ia64_fph_enable();
00233     __ia64_init_fpu();
00234     /* The mfh bit is automatically armed, since the init_fpu routine
00235        modifies the FPH registers. */
00236 }
00237 
00238 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00239 {
00240     unsigned long lpsr = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_PSR);
00241     struct ia64_psr *current_psr = (struct ia64_psr *) &lpsr;
00242     
00243     if (current_psr->mfh)
00244         {
00245         if(tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00246             {
00247             struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00248             struct ia64_psr *psr = ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(linux_fpu_owner));
00249 
00250             /* Keep the FPU save zone in sync with what Linux expects. */
00251             psr->mfh = 0;
00252             linux_fpu_owner->thread.flags |= IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID;
00253             }
00254 
00255         ia64_fph_enable();
00256         __ia64_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00257         ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00258         ia64_srlz_d();
00259         }
00260 }
00261 
00262 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00263 
00264 {
00265     struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner;
00266     int need_disabled_fph;
00267 
00268     if (tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00269         {
00270         linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00271 
00272         if((linux_fpu_owner->thread.flags & IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID) == 0)
00273             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00274 
00275         /* Disable fph, if we are not switching back to the task which
00276            owns the FPU. */
00277         need_disabled_fph = linux_fpu_owner != tcb->user_task;
00278         }
00279     else
00280         need_disabled_fph = 0;
00281 
00282     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00283        user-space or kernel thread. */
00284     ia64_fph_enable();
00285     __ia64_load_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00286     ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00287     ia64_srlz_d();
00288 
00289     if(need_disabled_fph)
00290         ia64_fph_disable();
00291 }
00292 
00293 
00294 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00295 {
00296 }
00297 
00298 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00299                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00300                                          const char *name)
00301 {
00302     tcb->user_task = current;
00303     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00304     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00305     tcb->fpup = current->thread.fph;
00306 }
00307 
00308 static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (struct xnthread *self,
00309                                       int imask,
00310                                       void(*entry)(void *),
00311                                       void *cookie)
00312 {
00313     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do ia64_fpu_enable() if needed. */
00314     ia64_fph_disable();
00315     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00316     rthal_hw_enable();
00317     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00318     entry(cookie);
00319     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00320 }
00321 
00322 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00323                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00324                                        void *cookie,
00325                                        int imask,
00326                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00327                                        char *name)
00328 {
00329     unsigned long rbs,bspstore,child_stack,child_rbs,rbs_size;
00330     unsigned long stackbase = (unsigned long) tcb->stackbase;
00331     struct switch_stack *swstack;    
00332 
00333     tcb->esp = 0;
00334     
00335     /* the stack should have already been allocated */   
00336     rthal_prepare_stack(stackbase+KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00337 
00338     /* The value of esp is used as a marker to indicate whether we are
00339        initializing a new task or we are back from the context switch. */
00340 
00341     if (tcb->esp != 0)
00342         xnarch_thread_trampoline(thread, imask, entry, cookie);
00343 
00344     child_stack = stackbase + KERNEL_STACK_SIZE - IA64_SWITCH_STACK_SIZE;
00345     tcb->esp = child_stack;
00346     swstack = (struct switch_stack *)child_stack;
00347     bspstore = swstack->ar_bspstore;
00348 
00349     rbs = (ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_SP) & ~(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE-1)) + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00350     child_rbs = stackbase + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00351     rbs_size = bspstore - rbs;
00352 
00353     memcpy((void *)child_rbs,(void *)rbs,rbs_size);
00354     swstack->ar_bspstore = child_rbs + rbs_size;
00355     tcb->esp -= 16 ;    /* Provide for the (bloody) scratch area... */
00356 }

00360 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00361 
00362     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00363 }
00364 
00365 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00366 
00367 {
00368     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00369                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00370                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00371                                      NULL,
00372                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00373 }
00374 
00375 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00376 
00377 {
00378     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00379                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00380                                      NULL,
00381                                      NULL,
00382                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00383 }
00384 
00385 static struct semaphore xnarch_finalize_sync;
00386 
00387 static void xnarch_finalize_cpu(unsigned irq)
00388 {
00389     up(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00390 }
00391 
00392 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00393 
00394 {
00395     unsigned cpu, nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
00396     cpumask_t other_cpus = cpu_online_map;
00397     unsigned long flags;
00398     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00399 
00400     init_MUTEX_LOCKED(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00401 
00402     /* Here adp_current is in fact root, since xnarch_notify_halt is
00403        called from xnpod_shutdown, itself called from Linux
00404        context. */
00405     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2,
00406                               xnarch_finalize_cpu, NULL, IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00407 
00408     adeos_lock_cpu(flags);
00409     cpu_clear(cpuid, other_cpus);
00410     adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, other_cpus);
00411     adeos_unlock_cpu(flags);
00412 
00413     for(cpu=0; cpu < nr_cpus-1; ++cpu)
00414         down(&xnarch_finalize_sync);
00415     
00416     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(adp_current, ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI2, NULL, NULL,
00417                               IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00418 }
00419 
00420 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00421

00423 
00424 {
00425     return 0;

00434 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00435

00437     return 0;
00438 }

00440 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00441 
00442 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00443 
00444 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00445 
00446 {
00447 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00448     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00449        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00450     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00451 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00452 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00453     xnshadow_release_events();
00454 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00455     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00456     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00457     schedule_timeout(50);
00458     xnarch_release_ipi();
00459 }
00460 
00461 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00462 
00463 {
00464     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00465 
00466     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00467         {
00468         spl_t s;
00469         splsync(s);
00470         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00471         splexit(s);
00472         return 1;
00473         }
00474 
00475     return 0;
00476 }
00477 
00478 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00479 
00480 {
00481 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00482     xnshadow_grab_events();
00483 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00484 }

00490 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00491 {
00492     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00493     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00494     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00495     tcb->fpup = tcb->fpuenv;
00496     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00497 }
00498 
00499 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */

00501 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00502 
00503 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00504                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00505                                            const char *name)
00506 {
00507     struct task_struct *task = current;
00508 
00509     tcb->user_task = task;
00510     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00511     tcb->esp = 0;
00512     tcb->espp = &task->thread.ksp;
00513     tcb->fpup = task->thread.fph;
00514 }
00515 
00516 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00517 
00518 {
00519     unsigned irq;
00520 
00521     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00522         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00523                              handler,
00524                              NULL,
00525                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00526 }
00527 
00528 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00529 
00530 {
00531     unsigned irq;
00532 
00533     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00534         {
00535         unsigned vector = __ia64_local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00536 
00537         switch (vector)
00538             {
00539 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00540             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00541             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00542             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00543 
00544                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00545                 continue;
00546 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00547 
00548             default:
00549 
00550                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00551             }
00552         }
00553 }
00554 
00555 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00556 
00557 {
00558     unsigned irq;
00559 
00560     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00561         {
00562         unsigned vector = local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00563 
00564         switch (vector)
00565             {
00566 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00567             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00568             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00569             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00570 
00571                 continue;
00572 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00573 
00574             default:
00575 
00576                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00577             }
00578         }
00579 }

00581 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00601 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00602                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00603                                         unsigned long long defval)
00604 {
00605 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00606     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00607     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ].t_handled;
00608     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[RTHAL_TIMER_IRQ].t_synced;
00609 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00610     *shot = defval;
00611     *delivery = defval;
00612 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00613 }
00614 
00615 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00646 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00647 
00648 {
00649     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00650 
00651     fltinfo.trap = evinfo->event;
00652     fltinfo.ia64 = *(ia64trapinfo_t *)evinfo->evdata;
00653 
00654     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00655 }
00656 
00657 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00658 
00659 {
00660 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00661     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00662 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00663     /* Compute the time needed to program the ITM in aperiodic
00664        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. */
00665     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00666 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00667 }
00668 
00669 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00670 
00671 {
00672     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00673 
00674     if (!nktimerlat)
00675         return -ENODEV;
00676 
00677     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00678 
00679     return 0;
00680 }
00681 
00682 static inline void stacksq_push(xnarch_stack_t *q, xnarch_stack_t *stack)
00683 {
00684     stack->next = q->next;
00685     q->next = stack;
00686 }
00687 
00688 static inline xnarch_stack_t *stacksq_pop(xnarch_stack_t *q)
00689 {
00690     xnarch_stack_t *stack = q->next;
00691 
00692     if(stack)
00693         q->next = stack->next;
00694 
00695     return stack;
00696 }
00697 
00698 void *xnarch_alloc_stack(unsigned long stacksize)
00699 
00700 {
00701     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00702     spl_t s;
00703 
00704     if (stacksize > KERNEL_STACK_SIZE)
00705         return NULL;
00706 
00707     if (adp_current == adp_root &&
00708         atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) <= CONFIG_RTAI_HW_STACK_POOL)
00709         {
00710         stack = (xnarch_stack_t *)
00711             __get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00712 
00713         if(stack)
00714             atomic_inc(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00715 
00716         return stack;
00717         }
00718 
00719     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00720     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00721     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00722 
00723     if (stack)
00724         atomic_dec(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00725 
00726     return stack;
00727 }
00728 
00729 void xnarch_free_stack(void *block)
00730 
00731 {
00732     xnarch_stack_t *stack = (xnarch_stack_t *) block;
00733     spl_t s;
00734 
00735     if (!stack)
00736         return;
00737 
00738     if (adp_current == adp_root
00739         && atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) > CONFIG_RTAI_HW_STACK_POOL)
00740         {
00741         atomic_dec(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00742             
00743         free_pages((unsigned long) block,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00744 
00745         return ;
00746         }
00747 
00748     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00749     stacksq_push(&xnarch_free_stacks_q, stack);
00750     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00751     
00752     atomic_inc(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00753 }
00754 
00755 static int xnarch_stack_pool_init(void)
00756 
00757 {
00758     while (atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) < CONFIG_RTAI_HW_STACK_POOL)
00759         {
00760         void *stack = xnarch_alloc_stack(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00761 
00762         if(!stack)
00763             return -ENOMEM;
00764 
00765         xnarch_free_stack(stack);
00766         }
00767 
00768     return 0;
00769 }
00770 
00771 static void xnarch_stack_pool_destroy(void)
00772 
00773 {
00774     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00775 
00776     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00777 
00778     while (stack)
00779         {
00780         free_pages((unsigned long) stack, KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00781         stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00782 
00783         if(atomic_dec_and_test(&xnarch_allocated_stacks))
00784             break;
00785         }
00786 
00787     if (atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks) != 0)
00788         xnarch_logwarn("leaked %u kernel threads stacks.\n",
00789                        atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks));
00790 
00791     if (xnarch_free_stacks_q.next)
00792         xnarch_logwarn("kernel threads stacks pool corrupted.\n");
00793 }
00794 
00795 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00796 
00797 {
00798     int err;
00799 
00800 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00801     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00802        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00803     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00804 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00805 
00806     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00807 
00808     if (err)
00809         return err;
00810 
00811     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00812 
00813     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00814         return -ENOSYS;
00815 
00816     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00817                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00818                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00819                               NULL,
00820                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00821 
00822     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00823 
00824 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00825     err = xnshadow_mount();
00826 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00827 
00828     if (err)
00829         goto release_trap;
00830 
00831     err = xnarch_stack_pool_init();
00832 
00833     if (!err)
00834         return 0;
00835 
00836 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00837     xnshadow_cleanup();
00838 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00839 
00840  release_trap:
00841     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00842     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00843 
00844     return err;
00845 }
00846 
00847 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00848 
00849 {
00850 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00851     xnshadow_cleanup();
00852 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00853     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00854     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00855     xnarch_stack_pool_destroy();
00856 }
00857 
00858 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00859 
00860 #ifdef __cplusplus
00861 }
00862 #endif
00863 
00864 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00865 
00866 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00867 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00868 
00869 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00870 
00871 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_IA64_SYSTEM_H */
